consent.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He took the car without the owner’s consent.
Her parents gave their consent to the marriage.
A patient can refuse consent for a particular treatment at any time.
Most owners are happy to have their names used for publicity if this is done with their prior consent.
Informed consent was obtained from all participants before the study began.
consent.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The chairman was elected by common consent (=with most people agreeing).
divorce by mutual consent (=by agreement between both the people involved)
consent.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: give (somebody) your consent
The child’s parents have to give their consent to the operation.
have somebody’s consent
He claimed to have the consent of the car’s owner.
get somebody’s consent
Your solicitor will need to obtain your signed consent.
something requires somebody’s consent
Your consent is required before we can apply for a medical report.
grant consent
The local council was prepared to grant consent to the project.
refuse (your) consent
When the firm applied for consent to build on the site, it was refused.
withhold (your) consent
A patient has the right to withhold consent to treatment.
written consent
If you are under 18, you need your parents’ written consent  to get married.
verbal consent
He gave his verbal consent to have the interview taped.
parental consent
Students may not be absent from school without parental consent.
somebody’s prior consent
Do not take photographs of people without obtaining their prior consent.
informed consent
The men took part in this study after giving informed consent.
express consent
Your medical records will only be released with your express consent.
tacit consent
If you continue to live in a particular state when it is possible to leave, this implies tacit consent to that state’s political system.
planning consent
You will need to apply for planning consent.
the age of consent
She was fifteen, under the age of consent, when she became pregnant.
consent.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to give your permission for something or agree to do something
consent.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage.
He rarely consents to do interviews.
consent.translation[2].definitions[0].de: permission to do something, especially by someone who has authority or responsibility
consent.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: He took the car without the owner’s consent.
The city authorities have given their consent to leases on two buildings.
consent.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The chairman was elected by common consent (=with most people agreeing).
His contract is to be terminated by mutual consent (=by agreement between both sides).
consent.translation[2].definitions[2].de: willing agreement to a contract and its conditions, without any force or dishonesty having been used. If someone has given consent, a court can force them to obey the contract
consent.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: Except under special circumstances the parents or guardians of the child must give their consent to the adoption.
